snippet: The members of the punk group Pussy Riot, Nadezhda Tolokonnikova and Maria Alyokhina, were questioned for several hours before being released without charges.
abstract: Nadezhda Tolokonnikova and Maria Alyokhina, members of Russian punk protest group Pussy Riot who were recently released from prison, are arrested in Sochi, not far from Olympic Village; women say arrests are attempt to prevent them from carrying out a new political protest action; they are later released.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW ROTH
byline.contributor: Patrick Reevell contributed reporting from Moscow, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: The members of the punk group Pussy Riot, Nadezhda Tolokonnikova and Maria Alyokhina, were questioned for several hours before being released without charges.

headline.main: 2 in Russian Protest Band Held, Then Freed, in Sochi
headline.print_headline: 2 in Russian Protest Band Held, Then Freed, in Sochi
